title: Integrate Plonkish constraints with protocol layer
description:
Wire the constraint system to the existing protocol layer:

- evaluate() output feeds into Protocol.prove()
- End-to-end test: build circuit → fill witness → evaluate → prove → verify

See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 4-5.

title: Implement core Plonkish types: Cell, Term, Constraint
description:
Implement the core type definitions for the Plonkish constraint system:

- Cell: column + rotation offset reference
- Term: coefficient × product of cells  
- Constraint: struct with terms slice and validRowRange() method

The validRowRange() method computes valid row bounds from rotations - no wraparound.

~40 lines. See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 1.

title: Implement constraint.zig - CCS evaluation
description:
Create src/trace/constraint.zig with:
- evaluate(ccs, trace) -> []F
- Evaluates CCS constraints over all rows
- Output is multilinear polynomial evaluations on {0,1}^n
- For valid witness: all zeros
- This []F goes directly to Protocol.prove()

title: Implement trace.zig - Dynamic column storage
description:
Create src/trace/trace.zig with:
- Trace struct with dynamic columns (ArrayList)
- Column struct with name, values, ColumnKind
- ColumnKind enum (witness, public, selector, fixed)
- Power-of-2 padding
- getPublicValues() extraction
- Basic tests

title: Implement Trace column storage
description:
Implement Trace struct for column-major witness storage:

- Column storage with ArrayList([]F)
- addColumn() returns column index
- set(col, row, val) to populate cells
- get(col, row, rot) with bounds checking (no wraparound)
- markPublic(col) and getPublicValues()
- Power-of-2 row count requirement

~50 lines. See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 1.1.

title: Implement builder.zig - CircuitBuilder API
description:
Create src/trace/builder.zig with:
- CircuitBuilder struct
- witness(name) -> column index
- public(name) -> column index  
- add(a, b, c) - place addition gate
- mul(a, b, c) - place multiplication gate
- set(row, col, val) - set witness value
- build() -> Trace + CCS
- Automatic selector column generation

title: Implement CircuitBuilder API
description:
Optional ergonomic layer for common constraint patterns:

- CircuitBuilder struct wrapping Trace + ConstraintSet
- addWitness(), addPublic() for column creation
- mulGate(a, b, c): a * b = c
- addGate(a, b, c): a + b = c
- constGate(a, val): a = constant
- transition(col, delta): col[row+1] = col[row] + delta
- build() returns trace + constraints

Tests: chained arithmetic, fibonacci sequence.

~80 lines. See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 3.

title: Implement ccs.zig - CCS constraint definition
description:
Create src/trace/ccs.zig with:
- CCS struct definition
- Column-selector abstraction (each term selects columns, not full sparse matrix)
- Term struct with coefficient and column indices for products
- Support for selector-gated constraints (s_add, s_mul)

title: Integration tests - arithmetic and fibonacci
description:
Test the CCS frontend:
- Single add gate test
- Single mul gate test  
- Chained arithmetic (a*b + c)
- Fibonacci circuit (fib[i] + fib[i+1] = fib[i+2])
- Invalid witness produces non-zero constraints
- Verify output []F can be passed to Protocol

title: Implement constraint evaluation
description:
Implement the core evaluation algorithm:

- evaluate(constraints, trace) → []F
- Each constraint evaluated only on its validRowRange()
- isSatisfied(evals) helper to check all zeros

Tests: multiplication gate, addition gate, invalid witness detection, rotation range boundaries.

~30 lines. See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 2.

title: CCS Plonkish Frontend
description: Implement multilinear CCS-based constraint system as frontend for the prover. Produces traces and constraint polynomials for Protocol.prove().
